content: x 4 slip_stitch join to 1st double_crochet all sizes 50 double_crochet + 50 chain = 100 stitches in round 2 solid double_crochet stitch is worked on all sides with a v_stitch between into each v_stitch round 2 slip_stitch to ch1 space v double_crochet in each double_crochet to and including double_crochet of next v x 4 slip_stitch join to 1st double_crochet all sizes 104 double_crochet + 4 chain = 108 stitches continue to work the yoke by repeating rounds 1 and 2 adding 8 stitches each round for a total of 21 23 25 27 rounds be sure to finish with a r2 repeat size s 252 stitches = 4 chain + 51 double_crochet each sleeves + 73 double_crochet each for front & back other sizes will have 4 8 12 extra double_crochet in each section and a total of 268 284 300 stitches body from now on there are no v stitches and so no increases instead alternating rounds of solid double_crochet and filet crochet are worked straight down in joined rounds on the setup round the sleeve stitches are skipped by making the 1st double_crochet as directed then rotating the work clockwise anti-clockwise if left-handed ignoring the sleeve stitches and making the next double_crochet in the v_stitch which marks the other side of the sleeve setup slip_stitch to ch1 space dc1 ch1 skip sleeve stitches dc1 in chain space of v * ch1 skip1 dc1 repeat from * to stitch before next v ch1 skip1 x 2 slip_stitch join to 1st double_crochet body now separated from sleeves - size s 152 160 168 176 stitches page 3 boatneck raglan jumper 1st armhole 2nd armhole round 1 dc1 in each stitch to end of round slip_stitch join to 1st double_crochet 152 160 168 176 double_crochet round 2 dc1 ch1 skip1 to end of round slip_stitch join to 1st double_crochet s 76 double_crochet + 76 chain = 152 stitches continue working body alternating rounds 1 and 2 until desired length reached ending with a solid double_crochet round r1 work a ribbed edge if desired e g 2 rounds of fpdc alternating with extended single_crochet i didn t work a rib on the jumper pictured here but did on my dark green one see my projects sleeves the sleeve decreases are worked in a 4-round repeat decreasing once at the end of the 3rd and 4th rounds join yarn at an underarm seam by working an slip_stitch through both v_stitch spaces round 1 dc1 * ch1 skip1 dc1 repeat from * to 2nd last stitch or 1st time only to stitch before the v skip last stitch ch1 slip_stitch join to 1st double_crochet 52 56 60 64 round 2 double_crochet in each stitch to end of round slip_stitch join to 1st double_crochet 52 56 60 64 decrease on r3 by omitting final ch1 i e r3 is the same as r1 except very last ch1 round 3 dc1 * ch1 skip1 dc1 repeat from * to 2nd last stitch skip last stitch
